comments.body: Can you update the commit log? Actually - given that this is a git patch with a sha you cannot just modify the diff :-) Could you instead add another patch? @amadio what do you suggest here?
I just `cherry-pick` commit from @amadio repository and produce cumulative patch from two commits. I have no idea how many patches can be applied using cmake `ExternalProject`

I created the diff with `git format-patch`, that's why there's a hash there. For ROOT, that hash is meaningless. @linev added another commit (with its own commit message) below, which is fine. However, I think that the patch should only get rid of the warning by removing the line I comment below rather than comment that whole template.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +3,7 @@Date:   Fri Mar 6 10:46:02 2020 +0100

    Avoid redefinition of _bit_scan_{forward,reverse} macros
    
    Fixes #247.

comments.body: Just removing the `Vc_DEPRECATED(...)` here should do. If we remove the whole template, it might break code using this only with builtin-vc, which will be annoying to debug later.

> If we remove the whole template, it might break code using this only with builtin-vc, which will be annoying to debug later.

Code is not used now in ROOT and should not be used in the future - therefore just comment out.
